title: Per-directory settings (seaview.toml)
description: Save and load per-directory settings as seaview.toml in the viewed directory. Initial focus: camera position, source coordinates, playback speed, loop toggle. Settings are loaded on startup and saved via UI controls (e.g. Save Camera button).

title: Define Settings struct with TOML serialization
description:
Create a Settings struct in a new settings module (lib/settings.rs):

- camera_position: [f32; 3] (translation)
- camera_rotation: [f32; 4] (quaternion) or [f32; 3] (euler angles - more human-editable)
- source_coordinates: String (yup/zup/fluidx3d)
- playback_speed: f32
- loop_enabled: bool

Use serde + toml crate for serialization. The struct should have sensible defaults via Default trait. Add toml and serde dependencies to Cargo.toml.

title: Load seaview.toml on startup
description:
When seaview opens a directory or file:

1. Resolve the target directory (parent dir if file, dir itself if directory)
2. Check for seaview.toml in that directory
3. Deserialize into Settings struct
4. Insert as a Bevy Resource
5. Apply settings:
   - Camera: set Transform on camera entity
   - Source coords: override CLI default (CLI flag should still win if explicitly set)
   - Playback: set speed and loop on UiState

Precedence: CLI flags > seaview.toml > built-in defaults

title: Save Camera button in UI
description:

2. Load existing seaview.toml if present (preserve other settings)
3. Update camera fields
4. Write back to seaview.toml in the sequence directory
5. Show brief confirmation in UI (e.g. toast/info message)

The button should sit near the existing center-camera (ðŸŽ¯) button. Needs to know the sequence directory path - get from Args resource or SequenceManager.

title: Save playback settings to seaview.toml
description:
Auto-save or manual-save playback settings (speed, loop) to seaview.toml. Options:

- Option A: Save automatically when changed (may be noisy)
- Option B: Save when Save Camera is pressed (bundle with camera save)
- Option C: Separate 'Save Settings' button

Recommendation: Option B - bundle with camera save. The save button becomes 'Save View' and writes camera + playback state together.
